ratings.question_text: The readings/cases/textbooks used in this course were __________ .
Out-of-class assignments for this course were ___________ to my learning.
The workload for this course in comparison to other courses was ___________.
The pace of this class was ____________ for optimal learning.
Overall, the teaching assistant for this course was accessible, organized, and able to explain concepts clearly and thoroughly.
Field trips were well designed and ran smoothly.
I learned a lot from field trips.
How clearly does the instructor provide explanations of conceptual material?
How responsive to student comments was the instructor?
I would give the instructor of this class an overall rating of:
I would give this course an overall rating of:
Apart from how well the course was taught, how valuable is the course to students with interests similar to yours?
Did you participate in a work group as part of this course?

narratives.question_text: Please identify the teaching assistant with whom you interacted most closely _____________________ .
comments: There was no interaction with the TA. The TA's responsibility was solely to grade the homeworks.
Instructor: Kristofer Ron Covey  Kris Covey
Instructor: Kristofer Ron Covey  I did not interact with the teaching assistant outside of submitting homework assignments.
Instructor: Kristofer Ron Covey  He is very responsible and very nice.
Instructor: Kristofer Ron Covey  Kristofer Covey is a Doctoral student and he gets along well with students
Instructor: Kristofer Ron Covey  Kristofer Covey was the teaching assistant I interacted most closely with although he was the only teaching assistant in this course.

narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-14, if you wish
comments: Q3: This course had homework assignments that really helped to reinforce material, but did not cause undue burden. In this way, I came to class eager to learn more instead of dreading the next assignment.Q4: The pace of the class was great, with the exception of the last two weeks where we covered more material than could be reviewed during homework, making the learning more conceptual than earlier in the term.
This course is very helpful and covers the most important and commonly used sampling strategies.

narratives.question_text: What were the best aspects of this course?
comments: Clear concepts of how to best design a research project to get the most accurate sampling results for any given situation.
Dr. Gregoire knows the material like the back of his hand. I expect to be using this material in my future career as a forest manager/consultant.

(1) Learning a wide range of sampling techniques, how to apply them effectively, and understanding the limitations of the estimators associated with them.(2) Useful homework assignments that did not leave me feeling drained and unmotivated, but instead kept me interested in the material.(3) The ability to head to the field for the final project.(4) The professor provided excellent support, whether in class, by email, or in person. He clearly prioritized student understanding of the material, and was more than willing to help you understand whatever it was that was confusing.
opportunity to practice concepts in hw
The instructor is super responsible. The assignments are highly related to the lectures and help students to understand the most important concepts.
The field project work
The broad scope of the research on sampling methods is very valuable.

narratives.question_text: What aspects of this course need the most improvement?
comments: Field trips with practical work would be great!
It may have been helpful if the professor went back over test questions that students seemed to really struggle with.

This course was great, but it could be improved upon by including a little more hands-on training. We had one class where we stepped outside to use some sampling tools. This was wonderful, and answered many questions quickly and effectively. I think there are other opportunities for brief interludes that could help reinforce material. For example, we had a couple readings and a fair amount of discussion on the mirage method of correcting for edge effect when plot sampling. The readings and discussion were useful, but highly conceptual. I think it could have been useful to step outside and see this method in action.
Some real-world case studies can be introduced.
Class meeting time should be reschedule to mornings.

I strongly feel that the ability to present the course in a manner that strongly lets the students appreciate the value of the subject matter was not achieved. The nuances and the uniqueness of the sampling methods would have been further discussed through the use of examples that would have been relevant and how each of the methods varied from each other. Unfortunately this was not done.

narratives.question_text: Was the relationship between the course lectures and discussion/lab section
comments: N/A
Highly related.
There were no lab sessions in this course.

narratives.question_text: What were the strengths and weaknesses of your teaching assistant
comments: The only role I knew the TF to have taken in this course was that of grader -- his feedback for that was appropriate and helpful.
Instructor: Kristofer Ron Covey  He was never actually present in class, but I don't think Professor G. needs him to help run the show.
Instructor: Kristofer Ron Covey  I did not interact with the teaching assistant much, but he provided suitable turn-around of graded homework assignments.

Instructor: Kristofer Ron Covey  strengths: very patient and nice. Very fair grading.weaknesses: It would be better if he can lead some lab-section to help students deal with the homework and review the lectures.

Instructor: Kristofer Ron Covey  The relationship of the teaching assistant with the students were largely non-existent given especially that the TA only presented himself in class only at the second class meeting. While the return of the assignments to the students was acceptable, it could've been improved. I am not sure how other students took advantage of what the TA offered as consultation hours, however, I feel that there wasn't a lot of venue to clarify the course with the TA.

narratives.question_text: Discuss, if you wish, how this course fits into your overall program.  (Please feel free to describe how the course relates to your academic background.)
comments: I came into the course with a various data processing and manipulation tools. However, I lacked skills in statistically sound data acquisition and this helped to fill that gap. It provided an essential suite of skills that is not offered in any of the other courses, but which is essential for those doing field research.
It helps me to lay the foundation of understanding many related papers and evaluate existing sampling strategies.
I cannot conduct my research knowledge in this course

As a MESc student, I feel that different methods in research would be very useful in support of the research that I intend to conduct. Thus, it would be very useful to take this course in consonance with research methods, either in natural or social science.

narratives.question_text: Why did you take this course?
comments: Methods over results.
See Question 20.
my own interest
I want to know more about sampling design.
It provides me the skill that is instrumental in my study interest

I took the course as I wanted to have a foundation of sampling methods in the field. Also, I have already taken statistics courses in my undergraduate program as well as in my other graduate program. As such, I wanted to have an appreciation of higher level use of statistics.

narratives.question_text: Did the knowledge/skills that you gained from the course meet your expectations ?
comments: Yes. I have a good overview and great knowledge about certain sampling designs and can interpret data well!
Yes.

I did not know precisely what to expect from this course, so it met and exceeded my expectations. I came away feeling confident about the material we had covered, and with sufficient understanding of both the concepts and the notation used to convey those concepts that I can now explore new methods on my own.
Yes. Ilike this course very much!

I appreciate the different sampling methods and I would really appreciate the opportunity to put them into practice in the field. However, as part of my expectations, for a higher level course in statistics, for examples to be provided more fully and discussed in-depth in class. For those reasons, I feel strongly that my expectations in this class were not met.

narratives.question_text: If yes, what were the advantages and disadvantages of the group work?
comments: It was for the final project and I think having another student's input will be helpful.
N/A

this is a difficult course, so when group work is involved, necessarily some students understand the material better than others, leading to a serious lack of parity in the amount of effort put forth per student in the final project
It provided the opportunity to relate theory to practice

narratives.question_text: For students who might consider taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: This class is particularly useful if you plan on doing field sampling of vegetation or non-moving things like rocks or soil.

(1) This course seems like it might be most useful for those planning to do summer research. As such, taking it during the first fall term (for those at FES), might be most useful. That said, it provided a set of skills that no other course at FES offers, and so is essential for any research scientist hoping to gather and manipulate data in the future.(2) The professor is very willing to answer questions, but he will keep going unless students stop him. Don't be afraid to say that you don't understand - chances are most of the students in the class will be in the same boat. When stopped, the professor was always willing to spend as long as it took to make sure people grasped the confusing material.
Feel free to ask the professor questions.
All natural science students should take this course

I believe that if the lectures will be improved and the concepts comprehensively or exhaustively discussed, then this course will be very valuable and useful, especially for people who will be practitioners in the field. However, if these caveats are not met, I do not especially recommend taking this course under this professor.
